Authors:
Teresa Iturriaga, Katherine F LoBuglio, Donald H.
Pfister
Title:
Bulgariella pulla, a Leotiomycete of uncertain placement,
with an uncommon type of ascus opening
Keywords:
ascus dehiscence, Helotiales, Pezizomycotina, phylogeny,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Bulgariella pulla (Leotiomycetes) is redescribed with the
addition of characters of the ascus, spores and habitat that were
previously not considered. Lagerheima sphaerospora (≡ Bulgariella
sphaerospora, type species of the genus Lagerheima) is confirmed to be
conspecific with B. pulla, type species of Bulgariella. The genus
Bulgariella, the older name, includes a single species B. pulla. Asci
lack a pore and open by splitting to form valves. This is an unusual
feature in the Leotiomycetes. Phylogenetic analyses of DNA sequences
from Tef1-α, RPB2, and the 18S and 28S rRNA genes determined that
Bulgariella belongs within the Leotiomycetes without satisfactory
placement. A comparison of the ITS-5.8s rDNA region among the five
isolates of Bulgariella examined determined that the Bulgariella
isolates from the USA, Norway and Sweden had 100 % sequence similarity,
while the isolate from Chile had 99.3% similarity to these
isolates.

trees.title: Bulgariella SSU rDNA, LSU rDNA, EF, RPB2
